metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6954 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
systemd-tmpfiles in systemd through 237 mishandles symlinks present in non-terminal path components, which allows local users to obtain ownership of arbitrary files via vectors involving creation of a directory and a file under that directory, and later replacing that directory with a symlink. This occurs even if the fs.protected_symlinks sysctl is turned on.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6954` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 229-4ubuntu21.15
libnss-mymachines - 229-4ubuntu21.15
libnss-resolve - 229-4ubuntu21.15
libpam-systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.15
libsystemd0 - 229-4ubuntu21.15
libudev1 - 229-4ubuntu21.15
systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.15
systemd-container - 229-4ubuntu21.15
systemd-coredump - 229-4ubuntu21.15
systemd-journal-remote - 229-4ubuntu21.15
systemd-sysv - 229-4ubuntu21.15
udev - 229-4ubuntu21.15
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> original fix was incomplete, see second pull chrisccoulson> Fix reverted in xenial because it breaks containers running on pre-2.6.39 kernels mdeslaur> fix was re-introduced in xenial in 229-4ubuntu21.15

criterions.comment: systemd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '229-4ubuntu21.15').
